divs: sighting detailsi was at an air balloon race in my first year of college and first month living in reno. i think they call it dawn patrol. anyway, i was with a friend of mine and i was taking photographs of the even with no flash and long\open shutter on my canon rebel xt. i'm a photography student and i prefer my photos to be more "organic" than anything else, so i don't use flash. i was watching the balloons and taking pictures, and every no and then looking back at the photos to see what kind of pictures i was getting. it was about 5am in the morning when the races started. i looked back at some pictures to see this blue line moving across the sky. i understand that with the slow shutter likes move around, but everything else in the photos was still and it was much, much brighter than other stars and objects. i had started just watching with my eyes, not through the camera's viewfinder, and started to see the light moving around. it was not a plane. i noticed that it would move, stop, move, stop, move, stop, erratically. i'm a big believer in ufo's, as is my mom who says she saw one decades ago in new york. i, however, had never seen one. so i decided to open the shutter completely, set the camera on the ground and hold it still so that the camera's movement couldn't be a cause of the light moving in the picture. i caught it in pictures clearly about 3 times. but the blueish quick moving light wasn't the only one i saw. there was also a green bar that seemed to show up randomly in my photos that i saw with my own eyes a few times as well, this one seemed to show up more often in my pictures at home after the balloon races. i'm not positive about the green one and it's validity as some kind of ufo, but it shows up randomly and i've never seen this kind of light show up in my photographs, ever, and i know my camera. at my first sight of the blue one i felt confused and then realized what i thought it was a became excited and had to have more pictures. i was really grateful that it was dark and that i knew, as an experienced photo-taker, that a slower shutter would show its movements, not just a snapshot. eventually the objects randomly disappeared as morning came. it was awesome to see. i have more pictures for you guys if you want them, i gave the three that are, in my opinion, the best out of the bunch. none of the three are the green one, if you want to see those, i'll send them. they're also all pretty large photos, so hopefully you can zoom in enough to see them.
trends: There have been 65 other sightings in Reno
There was one other sighting in Reno on or around September 9th 2006
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: Fast and erratic moving star-like things
Object Flight Path: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
